meanings.definition: A short, high-pitched sound made by a bird or small animal.
meanings.sent1: The little bird let out cheerful cheeps in the morning.
meanings.sent2: I heard the sweet cheeps of the baby chicks in the nest.
meanings.sent3: The forest was filled with the happy cheeps of the tiny birds.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a melody of delicate cheeps.
meanings.sent5: The classroom echoed with the soft cheeps of the pet hamster.

meanings.definition: To make a series of short, high-pitched sounds.
meanings.sent1: The birds cheeped happily as they flew overhead.
meanings.sent2: She cheeps whenever she sees her favorite treats.
meanings.sent3: The kittens cheeped in protest when bath time arrived.
meanings.sent4: The old door cheeped loudly as it opened slowly.
meanings.sent5: The excited children cheeped with joy at the surprise party.

meanings.sent1: The tiny mouse made soft cheeps as it scurried across the floor.
meanings.sent2: The distant cheeps of the cricket filled the night air.
meanings.sent3: The toy robot emitted cute cheeps when turned on.
meanings.sent4: The wind carried the cheeps of the distant songbirds.
meanings.sent5: The cheeps of the baby squirrel caught my attention in the park.
